Subsection.title: Description
Subsection.Paragraph: documentation - Add documentation to an element

Subsection.title: Overview
Subsection.Paragraph: The documentation specifies a paragraph of documentation for an element.

Subsection.title: Semantics
Subsection.Paragraph: A documentation statement (documentation T s) adds the documentation string s to the object T.

ListUnordered.Item: Inside packages, where the target objects may be types or protocols.
Inside record definitions, where the target objects may be fields within the record, or type parameters on the record.
Inside variant definitions, where the target objects may be the cases of the variant, or type parameters on the variant.
Inside variant cases, where the target objects may be fields within the variant case.

Subsection.Paragraph: Documentation statements may refer to objects that are yet to be defined. For example, it is possible to specify documentation for a record field before that record field is defined. However, it is an error to refer to objects that are never defined. Implementations are encouraged to perform binding analyses of documentation statements in a separate pass after the definitions of other objects are checked.

Subsection.title: Example
Subsection.Paragraph: The following statement adds documentation to a Color record type:

FormalItem.title: Package Example
FormalItem.Verbatim:
(package com.io7m.cedarbridge)
(documentation Color "The type of linear RGB color vectors.") (record Color (documentation red "The red channel.") (field red Float64) (documentation green "The red channel.") (field green Float64) (documentation blue "The red channel.") (field blue Float64))
